channel.title: Flash sucks, help me?
channel.description:
So the proprietary Flash for Linux sucks, I know that, you know that. But we have to put up with this crap nonetheless. I'm having issues with my Internet disconnecting when playing a flash video. It's pretty much anytime I watch a flash video. Especially when it's a long video, or a high quality video.
I googled, and no one else seems to have this issue. I thought about going to the ubuntu forums, but I thought I'd ask here first.

item.title: Flash sucks, help me?

Thanks for the help.

item.title: Flash sucks, help me?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I just finished upgrading, and it fixed the problem. Whatever it was, it’s fixed now.

Read full topic

item.title: Flash sucks, help me?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Elijah:

All other computers and devices on my network can play videos without disconnecting, yes. In fact it’s a little more simple than that. It’s being dropped at the computer, not at the router. I get a little popup noticing me that the internet has disconnected. And then it reconnects in less than 2 or 3 seconds.

Ok, that makes slightly more sense I guess. It still doesn’t make sense that flash would have anything to do with your internet connection though. I guess I would try upgrading to 9.10 and seeing if that makes a difference.

Read full topic

All other computers and devices on my network can play videos without disconnecting, yes. In fact it’s a little more simple than that. It’s being dropped at the computer, not at the router. item.title: Flash sucks, help me?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Works fine for me. But I am on 9.10 (latest, karmic) running with ethernet (cable) firefox 3.5.8, and the latest flash.

I do recall hearing that 9.10 incorporates a fix to the X server that helps flash play smoother, but it shouldn’t be cutting your internet off no matter what. Do you have another operating system or computer on the same network to test and see if the internet disconnects with those?

Read full topic

item.title: Flash sucks, help me?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Ubuntu 9.04, at&t DSL? or ethernet if that’s what you’re wondering, Firefox 3.0.17, latest version of flash. And pretty much any video will do it. Also, I removed the package, and then reinstalled it, and didn’t help.

item.title: Flash sucks, help me?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Are you using ubuntu? You didn’t really say. Also what version and architecture? What kind of internet do you have and driver? What browser are you running and are you running the latest version of flash? Perhaps a link to a video that disconnects would be good too, I’ve never had that kind of problem myself.

Read full topic
